Brave Browser

A privacy-focused browser that pays you in Basic Attention Token (BAT) for viewing ads while you browse the web.

Download Now How to Set Up

About Brave Browser

App Details

Category: Browser Rewards
Monthly Earnings: $3-10
Payment Methods: Uphold, Gemini, Self-Custody
Minimum Payout: None
Platforms: Windows, macOS, Linux, Android, iOS
Setup Difficulty: Easy
Resource Usage: Medium
Referral Program: Varies by region

Pros & Cons

Pros:

  • Enhanced privacy and security while browsing
  • Built-in ad and tracker blocking
  • Faster browsing experience
  • Earn cryptocurrency while browsing normally
  • Support content creators directly
  • Available on all major platforms
  • Based on Chromium (compatible with Chrome extensions)

Cons:

  • Lower earnings compared to dedicated bandwidth sharing apps
  • BAT token value fluctuates with cryptocurrency market
  • KYC verification required for withdrawals to exchanges
  • Limited withdrawal options
  • Earnings vary significantly by region

How Brave Browser Works

Brave Browser works differently from other passive income methods. Instead of sharing your resources, you earn by viewing privacy-respecting ads while browsing the web. Here's how it works:

  • Brave blocks traditional ads and trackers by default
  • You can opt into Brave Rewards to see privacy-respecting ads
  • Ads appear as system notifications, not in your browsing content
  • You earn Basic Attention Token (BAT) for viewing these ads
  • BAT accumulates in your Brave Rewards wallet
  • You can withdraw BAT to supported exchanges or use it to tip content creators

The key advantage of Brave is that you're not just earning passive income—you're also getting a faster, more private browsing experience. It's a win-win situation where you benefit from both enhanced privacy and passive earnings.

How to Set Up Brave Browser

1

Download Brave Browser

Visit the Brave website and download the browser for your operating system.

2

Enable Brave Rewards

Click on the triangle icon in the address bar and enable Brave Rewards.

3

Customize Ad Settings

Set your preferred number of ads per hour (up to 10) in the Brave Rewards settings.

4

Connect a Wallet

Connect to Uphold or Gemini to withdraw your earned BAT tokens, or use self-custody.

Download Brave Browser

BAT Price Tracker

bat-price-tracker.js 
          
            <span class="line-number">1</span>// Basic Attention Token (BAT) Price Tracker
<span class="line-number">2</span>async function trackBATPrice() {
<span class="line-number">3</span>  try {
<span class="line-number">4</span>    // Fetch current BAT price from CoinGecko API
<span class="line-number">5</span>    const response = await fetch('https://api.coingecko.com/api/v3/simple/price?ids=basic-attention-token&vs_currencies=usd,eur,gbp');
<span class="line-number">6</span>    const data = await response.json();
<span class="line-number">7</span>
<span class="line-number">8</span>    // Extract price data
<span class="line-number">9</span>    const batPrices = data['basic-attention-token'];
<span class="line-number">10</span>
<span class="line-number">11</span>    // Display current prices
<span class="line-number">12</span>    console.log('Current BAT Prices:');
<span class="line-number">13</span>    console.log(`USD: $${batPrices.usd}`);
<span class="line-number">14</span>    console.log(`EUR: €${batPrices.eur}`);
<span class="line-number">15</span>    console.log(`GBP: £${batPrices.gbp}`);
<span class="line-number">16</span>
<span class="line-number">17</span>    // Calculate potential earnings based on monthly BAT
<span class="line-number">18</span>    const monthlyBAT = 5; // Average monthly earnings in BAT
<span class="line-number">19</span>    const usdValue = monthlyBAT * batPrices.usd;
<span class="line-number">20</span>
<span class="line-number">21</span>    console.log(`
<span class="line-number">22</span>Estimated Monthly Earnings (with ${monthlyBAT} BAT):`);
<span class="line-number">23</span>    console.log(`USD: $${usdValue.toFixed(2)}`);
<span class="line-number">24</span>
<span class="line-number">25</span>    return {
<span class="line-number">26</span>      prices: batPrices,
<span class="line-number">27</span>      monthlyEstimate: {
<span class="line-number">28</span>        bat: monthlyBAT,
<span class="line-number">29</span>        usd: usdValue.toFixed(2)
<span class="line-number">30</span>      }
<span class="line-number">31</span>    };
<span class="line-number">32</span>  } catch (error) {
<span class="line-number">33</span>    console.error('Error fetching BAT price:', error);
<span class="line-number">34</span>    return null;
<span class="line-number">35</span>  }
<span class="line-number">36</span>}
<span class="line-number">37</span>
<span class="line-number">38</span>// Call the function
<span class="line-number">39</span>trackBATPrice().then(result => {
<span class="line-number">40</span>  if (result) {
<span class="line-number">41</span>    console.log('Price tracking complete!');
<span class="line-number">42</span>  }
<span class="line-number">43</span>});

Frequently Asked Questions

What is Brave Browser and how does it work?

Brave is a privacy-focused web browser that blocks trackers and ads by default. Its Brave Rewards program allows users to opt into viewing privacy-respecting ads and earn Basic Attention Token (BAT), a cryptocurrency, in return.

How much can I earn with Brave Browser?

Earnings vary based on your location, browsing habits, and the number of ads you choose to see per hour. On average, users earn between $3-10 per month. Users in the US, UK, and other high-ad-volume countries tend to earn more.

Is Brave Browser safe and legitimate?

Yes, Brave is a legitimate browser created by Brendan Eich, co-founder of Mozilla and creator of JavaScript. It's built on Chromium (the same technology behind Google Chrome) and focuses heavily on privacy and security.

How do I get paid from Brave Browser?

You earn BAT tokens which accumulate in your Brave Rewards wallet. To withdraw, you need to connect to a supported crypto exchange like Uphold or Gemini. You can also use the tokens to tip content creators or websites you enjoy.

Will I see annoying ads while using Brave?

No, Brave's ads appear as system notifications and are non-intrusive. They don't appear in your browsing content, and you can set how many ads you want to see per hour (from 0 to 10).

Start Earning with Brave Browser Today

Join millions of users who are already enjoying a faster, more private browsing experience while earning passive income.
